page.title: 17LEOMINSTER POLICE STATION
page.content: We visited the police station and our guide was P.C. Wilson. They have four cells and two had just been decorated. Two detention rooms are used for detaining runaway children and drunks. Exactly two hundred and fifteen arrests have been made this year. Any policeman who makes an arrest must have a good reason to explain to the sergeant, otherwise he is in big trouble. The arrested people are brought in through a barred door and put in a cell. Then we went to the radio room where there were C.B.'s and two way radios. They had a radio that calls out to Tenbury Wells, Hereford and Bromyard. A teleprinter is used to send telex messages and the radio man phoned Hereford and they sent us a telex message - Hope the children of{ {Leominster}Junior enjoyed their visit.
